title: Trump says ‘days numbered’ for Venezuela’s Maduro
summary: The US president sent mixed signals over his plans for Venezuela as his military build-up in the Caribbean continues.

title: Indian cricket fans celebrate first Women’s World Cup title
summary: Cricket fans have been celebrating across India after the women’s team claimed their first ever World Cup.

title: Narendra Modi leads tributes to women’s cricket team after World Cup win
summary: India is celebrating after winning a first women's World Cup, drawing comparisons to the men's memorable 1983 triumph.

title: Video: Afghanistan’s Blue Mosque damaged in earthquake
summary: Video shows earthquake damage to Afghanistan’s shrine of Mazar-i-Sharif, also known as The Blue Mosque.

title: Sudan slams RSF ‘war crimes’ in el-Fasher as survivors recount killings
summary: Envoy says Sudan will not take part in talks to end the conflict if the UAE is involved in negotiations.

title: LIVE: Israeli air strikes hit Gaza; 2 Palestinians killed in West Bank
summary: Israeli forces resume attacks on Khan Younis while its forces kill two people in occupied West Bank.

title: Sinner wins Paris Masters to reclaim world No 1 ranking from Alcaraz
summary: Jannik Sinner's first Paris Masters crown moves the Italian past Carlos Alcaraz and back into the ATP's top spot.

title: Calls for justice after Mexico mayor killed during Day of the Dead festival
summary: Carlos Manzo, an outspoken critic of organised crime, was shot dead during a public festival in the city of Uruapan.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,348
summary: Here are the key events from day 1,348 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Earthquake kills at least 20 as it strikes northern Afghanistan
summary: A magnitude 6.3 quake has struck near the city of Mazar-i-Sharif, months after an earthquake killed 2,200 people.

title: Colombia’s ELN rebels face US drug threats amid push for peace talks
summary: The US focus on drugs and nearby Venezuela brings an international dimension to what was an internal Colombian conflict.

title: Israeli forces kill another Palestinian in Gaza; Hamas returns 3 bodies
summary: Despite the ceasefire, Israel’s strikes and severe restrictions on aid leave Gaza’s civilians struggling to survive.

title: Gaza : Israël annonce avoir reçu trois dépouilles d'otages
summary: Trois dépouilles d'otages enlevés par le Hamas le 7 octobre 2023 ont été remises dimanche à la Croix-Rouge dans la bande de Gaza avant d'être transférées à l'armée israélienne, selon le bureau du Premier ministre israélien. Ils doivent encore être identifiés par l'Institut national de médecine légale.

title: Israël menace d'intensifier ses attaques contre le Hezbollah dans le sud du Liban
summary: Au lendemain d'un raid meurtrier contre des membres du Hezbollah au Liban, le gouvernement israélien a menacé, dimanche, d'intensifier ses attaques. Le Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu l'accuse de se "réarmer" et exhorte le Hezbollah à respecter ses engagements de désarmement, avertissant qu'Israël se réserve le "droit à l'autodéfense".

title: Les trois corps remis par le Hamas ne sont pas ceux d'otages, selon Israël
summary: L'armée israélienne affirme que les trois corps remis à Israël par le Hamas vendredi soir ne sont pas ceux d'otages enlevés le 7 octobre 2023. Le mouvement islamiste palestinien a jusqu'à présent restitué les restes de 17 des 28 corps qui se trouvaient encore à Gaza au moment de l'entrée en vigueur de l'accord de cessez-le feu voilà trois semaines.

title: Gaza : Israël a rendu les corps de 30 Palestiniens en échange de deux dépouilles d'otages
summary: Une trentaine de corps de prisonniers palestiniens ont été rendus vendredi par Israël en échange de deux dépouilles d'otages israéliens qui avaient été restituées la veille. Le Hamas a jusqu'à présent restitué les restes de 17 des 28 corps qui se trouvaient encore à Gaza au moment de l'entrée en vigueur de l'accord de cessez-le feu voilà trois semaines.

title: Depuis la guerre de 12 jours avec Israël, une répression accrue est observée en Iran
summary: Une Mission indépendante de l'ONU s'inquiète, jeudi, d'une hausse de la répression en Iran consécutive aux frappes israéliennes de juin, alertant sur le sort des personnes arrêtées, notamment des journalistes et des minorités, lors de la guerre. "Un regain qui reflète une tendance récurrente", déplore la présidente de la mission.

title: Les juifs ultra-orthodoxes massivement mobilisés à Jérusalem contre la conscription
summary: À l'appel des partis ultra-orthodoxes Judaïsme unifié de la Torah et Shass, des dizaines de milliers de manifestants se sont rassemblés, jeudi, à Jérusalem pour réclamer le rétablissement d'un arrangement qui exemptait du service militaire les étudiants des écoles talmudiques, avant son invalidation par la Cour suprême israélienne.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne a récupéré et identifié les corps de deux otages
summary: Israël a identifié les restes des otages Amiram Kuper et Sahar Baruch, dont les corps ont été rendus par le Hamas plus tôt dans la journée. Le Hamas palestinien avait déjà remis les restes de 15 des 28 corps qui auraient dû être rendus au début de la trêve.

title: The Guardian révèle l'existence d'un accord secret entre Amazon, Google et Israël
summary: À la Une de la presse ce jeudi : les révélations du Guardian sur un accord secret entre deux géants du numérique, Amazon et Google, et le gouvernement israélien concernant la divulgation d'informations confidentielles ; l'état des lieux accablant sur la sécurité des musées en France après le casse du Louvre ; la présentation d'un robot humanoïde bientôt disponible dans les foyers du monde entier et la pression des autorités russes contre la fête "satanique" d'Halloween.

title: Au Liban, le président Aoun demande à l'armée de "s'opposer à toute incursion israélienne"
summary: Le président libanais, Joseph Aoun, a demandé, jeudi, à "l'armée de faire face à toute incursion israélienne (...) pour défendre le territoire libanais et la sécurité des citoyens", après la mort d'un employé municipal dans le sud du pays.

title: Guerre à Gaza : un cessez-le-feu chancelant
summary: Moins de trois semaines après l'entrée en vigueur du cessez-le-feu dans la bande de Gaza, l'armée israélienne a mené de nouveaux raids sur l'enclave palestinienne, tuant au moins 100 personnes. Des frappes déclenchées après la mort d'un soldat israélien qu'Israël impute au Hamas – qui dément toute responsabilité. Le mouvement islamiste et l'État hébreu s'accusent mutuellement d'avoir violé la trêve.

title: Guerre à Gaza : un cycle sans fin ?
summary: Plus de 100 personnes sont mortes, mercredi, dans des bombardements israéliens, selon la Défense civile de Gaza. Alors que le Hamas et l’État hébreu s’accusent toujours mutuellement d’avoir violé la trêve, Israël a annoncé "reprendre le cessez-le-feu" après ces violentes frappes. De son côté, le président américain Donald Trump a assuré que "rien" ne compromettrait l’accord de paix qu’il a négocié entre Israël et le Hamas.

title: Gaza : Israël dit reprendre le cessez-le-feu après des frappes ayant fait plus de 100 morts
summary: La Défense civile et les hôpitaux de Gaza ont annoncé mercredi la mort de plus de cent personnes, dont de nombreux enfants, dans des bombardements israéliens. Israël a dit "reprendre le cessez-le-feu" après ces frappes. Malgré ces violences, le président Donald Trump a assuré que "rien" ne compromettrait l'accord de cessez-le-feu qu'il a négocié entre Israël et le Hamas. Retrouvez le fil de la journée du 29 octobre.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : l’ex-procureure générale de l’armée israélienne arrêtée pour avoir fait fuiter une vidéo montrant des violences de soldats contre des prisonniers palestiniens
summary: Après avoir annoncé sa démission, Yifat Tomer-Yeroushalmi est actuellement en garde à vue, selon le ministre de la sécurité nationale, Itamar Ben Gvir. La magistrate est accusée d’avoir secrètement autorisé la diffusion d’une vidéo prise en 2024 dans la base militaire de Sde Teiman.

title: Deux ans après l’arrivée au pouvoir de Donald Tusk, le désenchantement est immense en Pologne
summary: La coalition démocrate menée par le premier ministre est en panne. Le spectre d’un retour des nationalistes du PiS au pouvoir, épaulé par une droite encore plus extrême, n’a jamais été aussi patent.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : les dernières informations
summary: « L’Ukraine dispose à présent de plus de missiles Patriot », a annoncé Volodymyr Zelensky. Au début du mois d’août, Berlin avait annoncé la livraison prochaine de deux batteries supplémentaires Patriot et l’envoi de composants de ces systèmes « au cours des deux ou trois prochains mois ».

title: Fabrice Argounès, géographe : « L’histoire des méridiens éclaire comment la cartographie est devenue le théâtre des enjeux de pouvoir »
summary: De l’Antiquité à la colonisation et jusqu’à la fixation des fuseaux horaires au XXᵉ siècle, ces repères longitudinaux invisibles ont été tracés, imposés et contestés, jouant un rôle déterminant dans notre perception du monde, affirme le géohistorien dans un entretien au « Monde ».

title: Un séisme dans le nord de l’Afghanistan fait plus de vingt morts et des centaines de blessés, un bilan provisoire
summary: Ce nouveau tremblement de terre survient deux mois après celui qui a tué plus de 2 200 personnes dans l’est du pays.

title: Robert Hirsch, historien : « Encenser l’action du Hamas le 7 octobre 2023, ce n’est pas soutenir le peuple palestinien, c’est encourager l’antisémitisme »
summary: Après la proclamation, lors d’un « meeting » organisé à l’université Paris-VIII, par des étudiants de leur refus de condamner l’attaque terroriste, l’historien analyse, dans une tribune au « Monde », les ressorts de ce positionnement et de son succès auprès d’une partie de la jeunesse.

title: En Turquie, le scandale des arbitres parieurs secoue le monde du football
summary: D’après une enquête interne portant sur 571 arbitres, 371 possèdent des comptes pour jouer sur les matchs, ce qui leur est strictement interdit ; 149 ont déjà été suspendus, alors que l’affaire prend une tournure politique.

title: La guerre menée par Israël à Gaza continue d’agiter la scène musicale internationale
summary: Boycott, concerts de soutien, tribunes… Deux ans après le début de la guerre, les musiciens s’engageant en faveur des Palestiniens sont de plus en plus nombreux. Très forte au Royaume-Uni et en Irlande, la mobilisation prend plus difficilement en France.

title: La Russie espère faire vaciller l’Ukraine en frappant son réseau électrique
summary: Moscou mène une campagne systématique d’attaques aériennes contre le secteur énergétique ukrainien afin de plonger l’est du pays dans le noir et le froid. Le secteur opère une transition vers les énergies renouvelables et le stockage pour améliorer sa résilience.

title: « Accorder un répit sur la fin du moteur thermique ne ferait qu’accentuer le retard des constructeurs de voitures européens »
summary: Face à la concurrence chinoise, il est primordial de maintenir l’échéance de 2035 pour interdire la vente de voitures neuves à essence, estime dans sa chronique Stéphane Lauer, éditorialiste au « Monde ».

title: Les démocrates américains, défaits par Donald Trump il y a un an, confrontés à la rébellion de la base du parti
summary: Alors qu’une série d’élections partielles a lieu mardi, le parti apparaît dispersé, sans leader clair ni message unifié. Des militants veulent mettre en avant de nouvelles priorités et renouveler les cadres contre un appareil incarné par des élus inamovibles.

title: Comment Trump menace la santé mondiale
summary: Depuis sa réélection à la présidence des Etats-Unis, Donald Trump et son secrétaire à la santé, Robert F. Kennedy Jr, provoquent le chaos dans le monde de la santé. Dans ce podcast, Delphine Roucaute, journaliste santé au « Monde », analyse les retombées de cette nouvelle politique.

title: Israel launches raids in Khan Younis, conducts drone strike on civilian gathering
summary:
Israel launches raids in Khan Younis, conducts drone strike on civilian gathering

The Israeli army on Monday launched raids on areas in the eastern part of Khan Younis city in the southern Gaza Strip, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

Several Palestinians were wounded when Israel conducted a drone strike on a gathering of civilians in the town of Bani Suheila in the southern Gaza Strip.

title: Israel begins demolition operations in West Bank
summary:
Israel begins demolition operations in West Bank

Israeli forces on Monday began demolition operations in Wadi Rahal, south of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank, Al Jazeera reported.

Israel committed 194 violations of the ceasefire agreement that came into effect on 10 October, the director of the government media office in Gaza said. 

Israeli forces continued to violate the ceasefire agreement with artillery shelling targeting the eastern part of Deir al-Balah city in the central Gaza Strip on Monday. 

Palestinian sources said that Israeli warplanes also targeted the eastern areas of Gaza City early Monday morning.

The report said that powerful explosions were heard east of Gaza City, where Israeli forces were demolishing residential buildings

title: Eight-nation meeting in Turkey weighs Gaza plan and international force
summary:
Eight-nation meeting in Turkey weighs Gaza plan and international force

Foreign ministers from eight nations are meeting in Istanbul on Monday to discuss the implementation of the Gaza "peace plan". The meeting brings together top diplomats from Turkey, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, the United Arab Emirates, Jordan, Pakistan and Indonesia.

Talks are expected to centre on the October 10 ceasefire and the second phase of Trump’s proposed 20-point peace plan.

The plan calls for Hamas to be disarmed and excluded from Gaza’s future governance, and for the deployment of an international stabilisation force. 

Members of the Israeli parliament's Foreign Affairs and Defence Committee were reportedly told during a briefing that the international force will be made up of soldiers from Indonesia, Azerbaijan and Pakistan.

title: Lebanese army mobilises near border after Israeli troop movement
summary:
Lebanese army mobilises near border after Israeli troop movement

Following Israeli military movements near the border, the Lebanese army mobilised its forces in the border town of Meiss El-Jabal in southern Lebanon, local media said.

Israeli army forces were placed on alert inside the occupied territories next to Meiss El-Jabal, prompting the Lebanese army to mobilise and deploy vehicles and troops in the area, according to the Lebanese state news agency NNA. 

The development comes after Lebanese President Joseph Aoun on Thursday instructed the army to confront any Israeli military incursions into southern Lebanon.

His directive followed an Israeli raid that killed a municipal employee inside the Blida municipality building in the south.

On Sunday, an Israeli drone launched three missiles near the Zefta–Nmeiriyeh junction in the Nabatieh area of southern Lebanon.

Israel continues to violate its ceasefire with Hezbollah, carrying out relentless attacks across southern Lebanon.

Dozens of people, including medics, journalists, and civilians, have been killed in Israeli strikes since the truce was agreed last November.

Despite its claims of “self-defence,” Israel’s repeated bombardments have drawn growing condemnation for fuelling instability and targeting non-combatants.

title: Bodies returned by Hamas identified as those of three Israeli soldiers
summary:
Bodies returned by Hamas identified as those of three Israeli soldiers

Israeli Prime Minister's office on Monday said that the bodies returned by Hamas on Sunday have been identified as those of three Israeli soldiers, news agency AFP reported. 

This brings the number of dead captives handed over by the Hamas movement to 20, out of a total of 28 it is due to return. 

"After the completion of the identification process by the National Institute of Forensic Medicine, in cooperation with the Israeli police and the military rabbinate," the army "informed the families of the hostages killed in action (...) that their relatives have been repatriated to Israel and identified," the office said in a statement. 

The deceased have been identified as American-Israeli Captain Omer Neutra, Corporal Oz Daniel, and Colonel Assaf Hamami.

title: Israel violated ceasefire nearly 200 times since 10 October, media office says
summary:
Israel violated ceasefire nearly 200 times since 10 October, media office says

Israeli army committed 194 violations of the ceasefire agreement that came into effect on 10 October, director of the government media office in Gaza, Ismail al-Thawabta, said. 

The violations included the army crossing what is known as the “yellow line”, preventing the entry of medicines, medical supplies, displacement tents and mobile homes, in addition to the continuation of shooting, shelling and incursions, Al Jazeera Arabic quoted Thawabta as saying. 

From 10 October until the end of the same month, only 3,203 trucks entered out of the 13,200 trucks that were supposed to enter, at a rate of 600 trucks per day, with a compliance rate of no more than 24%, according to a statement issued by the government media office on Saturday.

title: Israeli warplanes strike Gaza as settlers raid West Bank villages
summary:
Israeli warplanes strike Gaza as settlers raid West Bank villages

The Israeli forces on Monday continued to violate the ceasefire agreement with artillery shelling targeting the eastern part of Deir al-Balah city in the central Gaza Strip, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

Palestinian sources said that Israeli warplanes also targeted the eastern areas of Gaza City early Monday morning.

The report said that powerful explosions were heard east of Gaza City, where Israeli forces were demolishing residential buildings

Meanwhile, settlers in the West Bank's Khirbet Masoud attacked farmers and burned a vehicle during an attack on a village south of Nablus.

title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian teen, settlers shoot another in West Bank
summary:
Israeli forces kill Palestinian teen, settlers shoot another in West Bank

Israeli forces on Monday shot dead 17-year-old Jamil Atef Hanani in Beit Fourik, in the occupied West Bank, the Palestinian health ministry said. 

Al Jazeera quoted sources in the occupied West Bank as having said that a Palestinian man died after being shot in the head by an Israeli settler in the Ras al-Joura area, north of Hebron.

The Palestinian Red Crescent said that Israeli forces prevented its crews from reaching the man.

Israeli forces also conducted search operations and arrested Palestinians during the raid across the West Bank on Sunday night and early Monday morning.

The towns of Allar, and the villages near Ramallah, northeast of Jerusalem and east of Bethlehem, were targeted in the raids.

title: Report: US proposes reconstruction of ‘New Gaza’ beyond Yellow Line
summary:
Report: US proposes reconstruction of ‘New Gaza’ beyond Yellow Line

US President Donald Trump’s administration has presented a proposal to potential Gulf donor countries to rebuild "New Gaza" on the eastern side of the strip, which is under Israeli control, Times of Israel reported. 

The report quotes two Arab diplomats familiar with the matter as having said that “new Gaza” is the term frequently used by US officials to describe the project that will take place on the eastern side of the Yellow Line.

Yellow Line is the the newly created boundary to which the Israeli forces withdrew on 10 October at the start of the Gaza ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas.

The partial withdrawal left Israel in control of roughly 53 percent of Gaza.

title: Trump says Gaza ceasefire not fragile, pledges support for Netanyahu
summary:
Trump says Gaza ceasefire not fragile, pledges support for Netanyahu

US President Donald Trump on Monday said that the ceasefire in Gaza is not fragile and that he would intervene to help Netanyahu, who he said was not being treated well in Israel. 

"The ceasefire agreement in Gaza is not fragile, but very solid. I would force Hamas to disarm very quickly if I wanted to, and it would be eliminated," Trump said in an interview with CBS 60 Minutes. 

"Netanyahu is the person Israel needed in times of war," he said. 

He added, "I don't think they treat him very well. He's under trial for some things, and... I think it should – you know, we'll – we'll be involved to help him out a little bit, because I think it's very unfair."

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Gaza, 23 days after a fragile ceasefire ended Israel's two-year genocidal war: 

  • Israeli warplanes targeted the eastern areas of Gaza City early morning on Monday morning. 

  • Israeli forces killed another Palestinian man in Gaza City, as the death toll since the ceasefire rises to at least 236.

  • Israeli forces stormed the city of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank, launched raids and arrested several citizens.

  • Israeli authorities say the remains of captives handed over by Hamas will be examined at Abu Kabir forensic institute in Tel Aviv, and that the identification process could take up to two days.

  • US President Donald Trump said one of the bodies was that of American-Israeli soldier Omer Neutra. The New York native’s parents have confirmed the identification. 

  • Israeli Army Radio said that "the family of Israeli prisoner Amir Nawtra announced that his body was returned to Israel yesterday".

  • Turkey is set to host a meeting on Gaza with the participation of several countries, including Egypt and Qatar. Discussions are expected to include the proposed "international stabilisation force".

  • Palestinian media reported that the Israeli forces are carrying out demolition operations on residential homes in southern Gaza.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • The death toll in the Gaza Strip since the start of Israel's genocide in October 2023 has risen to 68,865, the Palestinian health ministry announced. The majority of victims are women and children. The ministry added on Sunday that the number of wounded had increased to 170,670. 

  • It said the bodies of seven victims arrived at hospitals in the Gaza Strip over the last 24 hours, including three recently killed Palestinians, three recovered from under the debris, and one who succumbed to their wounds. Since the ceasefire took effect on 11 October, 236 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli forces and at least 600 others wounded.

  • Israeli forces launched attacks on Gaza and carried out home demolitions on Sunday despite the ongoing ceasefire agreement. 

  • An Israeli air strike killed a Palestinian man in the Gaza Strip on Sunday, Palestinian health authorities said.

  • Gaza’s Health Ministry says the bodies of 500 Palestinians have been pulled from the rubble since Israel’s assault supposedly paused under a US-brokered ceasefire.

  • The Palestinian Prisoner’s Society has confirmed the death of 63-year-old Mohammed Hussein Ghawadra from Burqin, near Jenin, who died today while being held by Israeli authorities.

  • Israeli forces detained at least 21 Palestinians during raids across the occupied West Bank on Sunday, including children.

  • Israel has warned that its military will step up attacks in southern Lebanon, a day after four people were killed in an Israeli air strike. Despite a November 2024 ceasefire with Hezbollah, Israel maintains troops in five areas in southern Lebanon and has carried out near-daily attacks.

  • Israel’s prime minister’s office has confirmed that the bodies of three deceased Israeli captives have been handed over via the Red Cross and returned to Israel.

title: Missing Tel Aviv professor found alive but in poor health, 8 days after disappearance
summary:
Nurit Yaari, found under a bridge by Tel Aviv's Ayalon River after extensive search, is thought not to have eaten or drunk since she went missing

The post Missing Tel Aviv professor found alive but in poor health, 8 days after disappearance appeared first on The Times of Israel.

US president claims Hamas will be 'taken out immediately' if it doesn't disarm, asserts Saudi Arabia isn't serious about conditioning Israel ties on eventual Palestinian state

Following Manchester terror attack, Blue Labour leader Maurice Glasman says working-class Brits are 'last bulwark' against rising antisemitism brought on by progressivism and migrants

Both the far-left Israel critic and the centrist Andrew Cuomo claim backing of Hasidic movement's Ahronim faction

Former head of leftist British party tells NYC mayoral candidate's supporters that he will be a voice for Palestinians 'while the terrible genocide goes on in Gaza'

Relatives of freed captives praise Alon for persistence and accountability; 'When I was taught in the army what an IDF commander should look like, I imagined someone like him,' says one

Chabad, Israid and others working to get clean water and supplies to locals after Hurricane Melissa pummels island with 360 Jewish residents

This year's performers include Ehud Banai, Shalom Hanoch, Yehuda Poliker, alongside Dudu Tassa, Ravid Kahalani and others

Number of dead hostages still in Strip drops to 8; Netanyahu vows to 'eliminate' last Hamas fighters in IDF-controlled parts of Gaza

Women, along with other activists, were trying to assist Palestinian olive growers with harvest, but were told they were violating a closed military zone order imposed that morning

title: Iran, US exchanging messages, but no negotiation process begun: Foreign Ministry
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei said that while messages are being exchanged between Iran and the United States through intermediaries, this does not mean that a negotiation process has begun between the two sides.

title: Army terms seizure of US ‘den of espionage’ a turning point in consolidating Iran’s political independence
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Islamic Republic of Iran Army in a statement on the occasion of the National Student Day, described this event as a turning point in consolidating the political independence and national dignity of Iranians.

title: Iran showed only a fraction of its power in war with Israel, now more prepared: FM Araghchi
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says the world witnessed only a fraction of Iran’s power during the 12-day war with Israel in June, emphasizing that the Islamic Republic is now even more prepared for any potential new conflict.

title: Araghchi sends message on realistic statements by Grossi, Omani FM
summary: Tehran, IRNA — Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi responded to the realistic statements of the Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency and the Foreign Minister of Oman by publishing a message on the X social network that Iran is not developing nuclear weapons.

title: Iran holds meeting of Special Committee on Caspian Sea Affairs
summary: Tehran, IRNA — The first meeting of the Special Committee on Caspian Sea Affairs was held with the presence of senior representatives of the relevant executive agencies and under the responsibility of Kazem Gharibabadi, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs for Legal and International Affairs and Special Representative of the Islamic Republic of Iran for Caspian Sea Affairs.

title: Israeli artillery shells southern Lebanon amid ongoing ceasefire violations
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Israeli artillery has fired incendiary shells at the southern Lebanese village of Aitaroun in another violation of the fragile ceasefire with the Arab country, Lebanese media reported.

title: Unbeaten Milan host surging Roma in top-of-the-table San Siro clash
summary: In a high-stakes Serie A clash at San Siro, an unbeaten AC Milan faces a surging AS Roma, with the hosts desperate to rediscover their winning form and the visitors aiming to solidify their place at the top of the league.

title: Redemption vs. history: Barcelona hosts Elche
summary: A struggling FC Barcelona, seeking redemption after a loss and poor form, faces a confident Elche CF. Elche, performing above expectations, aims to achieve its first-ever away win against Barcelona.

title: Palestinian groups vow resistance until liberation of occupied territories
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Palestinian resistance groups have described the Balfour Declaration that led to the creation of Israel as the beginning of a chain of oppression and crimes against the Palestinian people and their land.

title: Top security official calls on Iranian nation to resist ‘endless’ US demands
summary: Tehran, IRNA –Secretary of Iran’s Supreme National Security Council Ali Larijani says the enemy’s main goal, by setting unacceptable and impossible conditions in negotiations, has been to break the will of the Iranian nation.

title: Lufthansa to resume flights to Iran as Austrian Airlines restarts Vienna-Tehran route
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Lufthansa will resume flights to Iran next month, an Iranian aviation official said on Sunday, as Austrian Airlines – a subsidiary of the Lufthansa Group – restarts its direct Vienna-Tehran-Vienna route after months of suspension.

title: IRGC Navy ensures Iran’s maritime security, General Vahidi says
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Deputy Chief of the Armed Forces, Brigadier General Ahmad Vahidi, has emphasized that the security of the country’s maritime borders is the result of the sacrifices and round-the-clock efforts of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Navy.

title: Iran rejects receiving any official message via Oman
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei said no official message has been conveyed to Iran through Omani channels.

title: Putin, Xi tough, smart leaders, not to be toyed with: Trump
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – United States President Donald Trump has described Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese Premier Xi Jinping as “tough, smart leaders" who must be taken seriously.

title: Trump threatens to send US military to Nigeria
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump on Sunday said the US could deploy troops in Nigeria or carry out air strikes to stop the alleged targeted killing of Christians in the West African country.

title: Yemen ready to respond to Zionist regime: Ansarallah official
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – Mohammed al-Farah, a member of Ansarallah’s Political Bureau says Yemen is fully prepared to respond to Zionist war criminals.

title: Scenic road to Kandolus Village in northern Iran
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – The road leading to Kandolus Village, with its stunning natural landscapes, lush trees, and refreshing mountain air, is among the most beautiful rural routes in northern Iran.

title: Pakistan expels over 15,000 Afghan refugees
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – Afghanistan’s Commission of Refugee Affairs announced that Pakistan has forcibly expelled more than 15,000 Afghan refugees through three border crossings.

title: Not too late for Trump to reverse course
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said the justification for recent Israeli and US strikes on Iran has collapsed, urging President Donald Trump to rein in Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu and reverse course.

title: Front pages of Iran's English dailies on November 3
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran's English language dailies on Monday, November 3.

title: US to hold nuclear tests: Trump
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump said that the United States would hold nuclear tests but did not detail whether blasting of munitions is meant.

title: Seven dead, 150 injured in Afghanistan quake
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 03 (MNA) – Seven people were killed and 150 injured after an earthquake of 6.3 magnitude struck near one of Afghanistan's largest cities Mazar-e Sharif early on Monday, the local health directorate said on Monday.

title: Enemy in no position to wage new war against Iran: IRGC spox
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 02 (MNA) – Spokesperson of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) Brigadier General Ali Mohammad Naeini says that the Israeli regime and the United States are not in a position to renew their aggression against Iran.

title: Ex-Israeli military advocate goes missing after revelation
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 02 (MNA) – The Israeli regime military has confirmed that Military Advocate General Maj. Gen. Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi, who resigned on Friday, has gone missing.

title: چهارمین رویداد «بانوان بهشت» برگزار می‌شود/تجلیل از بانوان فعال هیئتی
summary: چهارمین رویداد ملی «بانوان بهشت» با حضور فعالان میدان خدمت به آستان اهل‌بیت (ع) و به انگیزه تجلیل از بانوان پیشکسوت، مدیر، سخنور و ستایشگران مجالس دینی آذرماه برگزار می‌شود.

title: شهید فهمیده؛ الگوی بصیرت است
summary: شهرکرد- فرمانده سپاه حضرت قمر بنی هاشم(ع) گفت: اعزام پیش از آغاز رسمی جنگ، نشان‌دهنده درک عمیق شهید فهمیده از شرایط کشور بود که باید از آن به عنوان الگوی بصیرت یاد کرد.

title: معرفی مدیران بخش‌های چهارمین جشنواره چندرسانه‌ای میراث‌فرهنگی
summary: مدیران بخش‌های مختلف چهارمین جشنواره بین‌المللی چندرسانه‌ای میراث‌فرهنگی معرفی شدند.

title: حریق در خیابان احمد پناهی سمنان؛ حادثه تلفات نداشت
summary: سمنان-‌ رئیس سازمان آتش نشانی سمنان از وقوع حریق در یک آغل گوسفند خیابان احمد پناهی سمنان خبر داد و گفت: خوشبختانه حادثه تلفات نداشته است.

title: آغاز عملیات بهسازی محور قم – نیزار با اعتبار ۱۸۰۰ میلیارد ریال
summary: قم- مدیرکل راهداری و حمل‌ونقل جاده‌ای استان قم از آغاز عملیات بهسازی محور ترانزیتی قم – نیزار به طول ۳۵ کیلومتر و با اعتباری افزون بر یک‌هزار و ۸۰۰ میلیارد ریال خبر داد.

title: نامی که سال‌ها در سایه اتهام ماند؛ قهرمانی که نیروی هوایی از دست داد
summary: علت ناشناختگی خلبان اسکندری، نه کمبود دستاورد، بلکه فضای ناعادلانه‌ای بود که در سال‌های پس از جنگ پیرامون او شکل گرفت.
